title: 112_hr2671
content: The Act is named the "Charles August Long Undiagnosed Diseases Research and Collaboration Network Act of 2011" or the "CAL Undiagnosed Diseases Research and Collaboration Network Act of 2011." It establishes the National CAL Network of Undiagnosed Diseases under the Public Health Service Act. The CAL Network, established under the CAL Undiagnosed Diseases Research and Collaboration Network Act of 2011, aims to provide a platform for physicians to collaborate on undiagnosed cases, facilitate cross-disease research, and improve patient care outcomes. The CAL Network, established under the CAL Undiagnosed Diseases Research and Collaboration Network Act of 2011, aims to assist in diagnosing cases, identifying commonalities, atypical presentations, and potential treatments. It also aims to describe types and prevalence of undiagnosed diseases, provide data on factors associated with these cases, outline key demographic factors, and understand the time taken for diagnoses. The curr_chunk discusses the need to improve access to programs like the Undiagnosed Disease Program at the National Institutes of Health for individuals with undiagnosed diseases in the United States. It includes expanding the program to establish additional programs at other locations. The Secretary will include information on undiagnosed diseases in the CAL Network to aid in early recognition, treatment, cure, and control of such diseases. The Secretary will ensure that the CAL Network is designed to make information available to health care professionals, patients, and other qualified individuals. This includes providing epidemiological data and other relevant information. The CAL Network provides access to information for Federal agencies and health-related agencies, with different levels of access granted based on circumstances. It ensures that individually identifiable information and trade secrets are not publicly disclosed. The Secretary may award grants to collect data on undiagnosed diseases and establish programs for such diseases. Implementation of the CAL Network must be completed within a year of enactment. The CAL Network must be fully operational by September 30, 2013. An undiagnosed disease is a medically unexplained chronic multi-symptom disease that causes decline in quality of life and has not been diagnosed by a specialist in a tertiary medical center. It is characterized by overlapping symptoms and signs without a known clinical diagnosis. The undiagnosed disease is characterized by overlapping symptoms and signs or inconsistent laboratory abnormalities. $5,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2012 through 2017 to carry out this section, with funds offset from the National Institutes of Health budget.
